availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Henry Fowler (Paducah, Kentucky, steamboat captain.)

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, steamboat captain. Salem, Kentucky native. Son of Wiley R. Fowler. Married to Martha Leech Fowler in Livingston, Kentucky on January 11, 1855. Father of Givin, Mildred, Minta, and Mattie Fowler. Steamboat captain in Paducah, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
"Long and Honored Career has Ended," The Paducah Sun, December 24, 1904. (accessed July 13, 2019).
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 946.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 131A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Livingston County Marriages, Film #000318176 p. 116.
Find A Grave, "Joseph Henry Fowler (1833-1904)," Memorial #66490291, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66490291 (accessed July 13, 2019).
